org.logicmill.util.concurrent

Class ConcurrentHashMapAuditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMapAuditor

  • public class ConcurrentHashMapAuditor
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that verifies the integrity of an instance of ConcurrentHashMap. This class uses ConcurrentHashMapProbe to gain access to private members of ConcurrentHashMap. To audit an instance of ConcurrentHashMap:
    
 ConcurrentHashMap map = new ConcurrentHashMap( ... );
 ConcurrentHashMapAuditor auditor = new ConcurrentHashMapAuditor(map);
 ...
 try {
        auditor.verifyMapIntegrity(true, 0);
 } catch (SegmentIntegrityException e) {
        ...
 }
    Author:
    David Curtis
    See Also:
    SegmentIntegrityException, BucketOrderException, EntryCountException, EntryNotReachableException, IllegalBucketValueException, IllegalOffsetValueException, NullEntryInBucketException, WrongBucketException, WrongSegmentException, ConcurrentHashMapProbe

    • Method Detail

      • verifyMapIntegrity

        public java.util.LinkedList<SegmentIntegrityException> verifyMapIntegrity(boolean throwImmediately,
                                                                 int maxExceptions)
                                                                   throws SegmentIntegrityException
        Performs an exhaustive examination of the internal data structures of an instance of ConcurrentHashMap, to verify the map's integrity. If the value of throwImmediately is true, this method will throw an exception upon encountering an error. Otherwise (throwImmediately is false) this method will return a list of exceptions that describe errors encountered during the examination. If the value maxExceptions is greater than zero, the examination will return at most maxExceptions exceptions in the list. Otherwise (maxExceptions <= 0) this method will return exceptions for all errors encountered in the map inspection. If throwImmediately is true, the value of maxExceptions is ignored.

        Each segment in the map is locked during the segment's examination. In general, it is best to perform this operation when the map is quiescent. It can be used, however, concurrently with operations on the map. Update operations on a segment will be blocked during the segment's examination. Retrieval operations will not be affected.

        Parameters:
        throwImmediately - if true, the first error encountered will cause an exception to be thrown; otherwise, exceptions will be accumulated and returned in a list
        maxExceptions - if > 0, limit on the number of exceptions returned in the resulting list; otherwise, no limit is imposed; ignored if throwImmediately is true
        Returns:
        list of exceptions describing encountered errors, if throwImmediately is false
        Throws:
        BucketOrderException
        EntryCountException
        EntryNotReachableException
        IllegalBucketValueException
        IllegalOffsetValueException
        NullEntryInBucketException
        WrongBucketException
        WrongSegmentException
        ConcurrentHashMapProbe
        SegmentIntegrityException
